questions.question: What does it mean for an astronomical body to be tidally locked?
questions.correct_answer: It means the body has reached a state where there is no net change in its rotation rate over the course of a complete orbit, often resulting in the same side always facing its partner.

questions.question: Why does the same side of the Moon always face Earth?
questions.correct_answer: The Moon is tidally locked to Earth, meaning it has synchronous rotation and takes just as long to rotate around its axis as it does to revolve around Earth.

questions.question: What are some alternative names for the tidal locking process?
questions.correct_answer: Alternative names for tidal locking include gravitational locking, captured rotation, and spin-orbit locking.
